abstract: Greek government moves to expedite evacuation of migrants from Syria and elsewhere that have crowded small island of Kos; aid workers estimate that roughly 6,000 to 7,000 refugees are staying on island, with hundreds more arriving each day from Turkey.
lead_paragraph: As the government tried to speed up the evacuation of Syrians and other migrants from the island of Kos, some migrants said they had been locked in a stadium.

headline.main: Greek Island of Kos, Overwhelmed With Migrants, Tries to Move Them Along
headline.print_headline: Migrant Tide of Syria War Overwhelms Greek Island

snippet: As the government tried to speed up the evacuation of Syrians and other migrants from the island of Kos, some migrants said they had been locked in a stadium.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
